column1:
224@Diplomacy@This classic game of pure negotiation has taken many forms over the years.

The first The Avalon Hill Game Co version has perhaps the widest release
column2: but Avalon Hill re-released the game in 1999
column3: complete with a colorful new map and metal pieces.  In 2008
column4:
Avalon Hill released a 50th anniversary edition with a new map and cardboard pieces representing the armies and navies.

In the game
column5: players represent one of the seven "Great Powers of Europe" (Great Britain
column6: France
column7: Austria-Hungary
column8: Germany
column9: Italy
column10: Russia or Turkey) in the years prior to World War I. Play begins in the Spring of 1901
column11: and players make both Spring and Autumn moves each year. There are only two kinds of military units: armies and fleets. On any given turn
column12: each of your military units has limited options: they can move into an adjoining territory
column13: support an allied unit in an attack on an adjoining territory
column14: support an allied unit in defending an adjoining territory
column15: or hold their position. Players instruct each of their units by writing a set of "orders." The outcome of each turn is determined by the rules of the game. There are no dice rolls or other elements of chance. With its incredibly simplistic movement mechanics fused to a significant negotiation element
column16:
this system is highly respected by many gamers.

Avalon Hill Complexity rating - 3

Re-implemented by:

    Colonial Diplomacy
    Diplomacy: Classical Variant
    Diplomacy: Hundred Variant

column1: 226@Taj Mahal@Northwest India at the beginning of the 18th century. The rule of the Grand Moguls is waning
column2: and the Maharishis and princes seize the opportunity to take control of the region. By influencing the prominent forces
column3: building magnificent palaces
column4: and ensuring a steady supply of commodities
column5:
the princes increase their power until the most successful has won.

The goal of the game is to gain the most influence points. These can be obtained by building palaces and by acquiring commodities. A palace can be built after securing the support of the Vizier
column6: the General

column9:
or the Grand Mogul. Commodities are gained by seizing control of a region or by retrieving them on a space where a palace has just been built.

There are twelve turns with an auction for the region control and the support of the Vizier
column10: General
column11: Monk
column12: Princess
column13: and Grand Mogul
column14: each represented by a different symbol. Players use cards in four colors to bid for the various prizes

column17: gain region tiles
column18: and increase your score accordingly. There are bonus points for connecting palaces over several regions on the map.After the final area on the board is auctioned

the player with the highest point total wins the game.

so no additional components are required. Anyone could use these rules with any version of the game.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/1AbjSJSVWFJ5GEXriWLd0w__original/img/pUWU53usRd2ck1OAXApT5haZUW4=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic4092498.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/1AbjSJSVWFJ5GEXriWLd0w__thumb/img/Hl5F3BOBmcd-NmdNfkbDHbqheNo=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4092498.jpg@2.9936@90@2@5

column1: 227@Black Orchestra@As Hitler's grasp on Germany tightens and his maniacal fervor is unmasked
column2: men from the highest levels of the Reich begin to plot his assassination. As the clock ticks and Hitler's ambitions grow
column3: these daring few must build their strength and prepare for the perfect moment to strike. The Gestapo hound their trail
column4: calling these conspirators "Schwarze Kapelle"
column5:
the Black Orchestra. Will this band of daring patriots save their country from utter ruin before it is too late?

Black Orchestra begins with each player choosing a historic figure involved in the conspiracy against Hitler. In this dark and dangerous pursuit
column6: motivation is perhaps your greatest weapon. If you can stay true to your convictions in the face of overwhelming threat and inspire your comrades
column7: then you will be able to use your special ability
column8: attempt plots
column9:
and even become zealous (necessary for some extremely daring plots).

But every move you make may also increase the suspicion of the authorities. The Gestapo will make routine sweeps
column10: and any players with high suspicion will be arrested and interrogated (possibly resulting in other players being arrested). If you are all arrested or if the Gestapo finds your secret papers
column11:
you lose. And the suspicion placed on each conspirator will increase the chances their plots are detected.

On a turn
column12: players may take three actions
column13: such as moving
column14: searching for an item
column15: or drawing a card; or
column16: at the cost of one action per die
column17:
roll the dice in an attempt to gain even more actions — at the risk of attracting the suspicion of the gestapo. This dice rolling "Conspire" action allows players to make bold moves when most needed.

After the actions have been taken
column18: an event card is drawn. The game is played over seven stages of World War 2
column19: represented by seven stacks of event cards. These cards walk you through the events of WWII in a roughly (but not strictly) chronological order. New stages open up new areas of the board
column20: cause Hitler and his deputies to interact with the Conspirators
column21: and present various opportunities or threats. During the final stage
column22: many board spaces become off-limits
column23:
as the Allies move closer to Germany.

To win
column24: players must collect a plot card and fulfill all necessary requirements listed (such as having Hitler be in a certain space and possessing certain items--detonator & fuse
column25: etc.). The active player may then attempt the plot by rolling the indicated dice
column26: including all additional modifiers and helpful Action cards. The total of number of "Target" symbols needed to kill Hitler is based on Hitler's military support
column27: but a Conspirator's security level decides if any "Eagles" rolled will see them detected
column28:
and foil the plot regardless. Players must consider their ability to successfully complete a plot and the relative suspicion levels of the different Conspirators involved.

Players will need to work together and agree on the wisest course of action
column29: as well as have a little luck
column30: to succeed. The phenomenon of one player dominating the game because of its cooperative nature is mitigated by the fact that there are no certainties
column31: and often a player will need to make a bold or reckless move to keep the conspiracy alive. Cool heads often prevail
column32: but play it too cool and you may miss your chance. The co-operative dynamic gets really interesting if a player is ever arrested
column33: and fails to resist interrogation
column34: then they will need to make a big decision all by themselves
column35:
without revealing their options to the group. No one player can guarantee success. It is hoped that players will have tense conversations similar to those had by the real conspirators and enjoy a truly unique historical experience.

so that only you and your followers remain.

Build caravans

is streamlined and non-random. Compete and win solely on your godly wits alone.

column1: 229@Dice Throne: Season One ReRolled@Dice Throne Season One ReRolled is a remastered edition of Dice Throne: Season One with two new characters! Fully redesigned with folding boards
column2: individual character storage trays
column3: Battle Chest storage
column4:
and two new heroes: Treant and Ninja!

Dice Throne is a game of intriguing dice
column5: tactical card play
column6: powerful heroes
column7:
and unique abilities.

It's a fast-paced 2-6 player combat game (1v1
column10: 2v2v2
column11: or free-for-all). Select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects
column12: such as granting permanent hero upgrades
column13: applying status effects
column14: and manipulating dice directly (yours
column15: your teammate's
column16:
or even your opponent's).

column1:
230@Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation@This Deluxe Edition of Reiner Knizia’s acclaimed Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation combines a superb craftsmanship with an exciting expansion for this award-winning game.

The Confrontation is a two-player board game in which players take control of the forces of Sauron
column2: seeking to find their master’s ring
column3: or the forces of the free peoples of Middle Earth seeking to destroy Sauron's ring in the fires of Mount Doom. One of the most acclaimed board games of recent years
column4: The Confrontation allows players to control many of the famous characters of Tolkien's famous trilogy
column5: while playing an intense 30-minute game that is a wonderful combination of bluffing and strategy. The Confrontation is designed by renowned game designer Reiner Knizia
column6:
and considered amongst his best works.

WHAT'S NEW:
Deluxe Confrontation gives the game a new and larger gameboard
column7: larger sculpted plastic stands
column8: and completely new artwork and graphic design.  The game includes 18 entirely new characters in addition to the classic characters found in the original. The new characters allow players to play an entirely new game
column9: or mix the new and the old characters for an entirely different game experience.  4 new Special Cards are also included
column10:
for additional special actions.

From the Box: The time has come for the final confrontation between Good and Evil in Middle Earth. Will the Hobbit Frodo and his companions bring the Ring to Mount Doom in Mordor? Or will they fall to the forces of Lord Sauron and lose Middle Earth to eternal darkness? Only one side can win!
The Confrontation is a complete stand-alone game of strategy
column11: bluffing
column12:
and adventure for two players.
This deluxe edition of The Confrontation features stunning new artwork
column13: a larger game board
column14: four additional special game cards
column15: and 18 beautifully sculpted character stand. In this edition you will not only be able to play the original classic game
column16: but also an entirely new game variant with 18 new Lord of the Rings characters. Furthermore
column17:
players can enjoy an exciting draft game variant in which they may choose which of the 36 available characters to field.

column1: 231@Schotten Totten@In Schotten Totten
column2: nine boundary stones lie between you and your opponent.  In front of each
column3: you build poker-like formations of three cards on a side.  Whoever plays the higher-ranking formation wins the stone.  And in a unique twist
column4: you may use your powers of logic to claim a stone even before your opponent has played all three of his cards
column5: by demonstrating that the stone is impossible for him to win.  Successfully claim five stones
column6: or any three adjacent stones
column7:
and you win the game.

In 2000 GMT published a rethemed version as Battle Line which includes an extra 10 "tactics" cards that modify the standard game play
column8:
and with cards that run from 1 to 10 (instead of 1 to 9).

The 2004 Edition of Schottentotten has these "tactics" cards too.
Schotten-Totten FAQ.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/69mwXe7c6HNYmT6S35Y4zg__original/img/C5YBiD7Qhpkf5FO1GteEjo9KRVE=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic2932872.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/69mwXe7c6HNYmT6S35Y4zg__thumb/img/97DW-2XWDrSSkgy3XnUJ7f7tLiQ=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic2932872.jpg@1.7133@20@2@2

column1: 232@De Vulgari Eloquentia@Italy
column2: late Middle Ages. The fabric merchants need to write down their contracts in a language that everyone can understand and the literates are looking for an alternative to the elite of the traditional Latin language. So
column3: the Volgare
column4: the language spoken by the common people
column5: taken from the dialects spoken in the various Italian regions
column6: starts to gain relevance. During this period
column7: Francesco D’Assisi writes his famous Canticle of the Sun and Dante writes the Divine Comedy
column8:
both written in Volgare.

The players will have to do their part in the creation of this new language! But who will provide them the proper knowledge to understand the manuscripts in the different dialects? Who will succeed to uncover the secrets of the books inside the Papal Library? Who will embrace the religious life and who will remain a merchant? Some of the players can become a famous banker
column9: someone else can climb the church’s hierarchy to be the next Pope! But in the end
column10:
who will be the most appreciated and respected for his status and his culture?

The aim of the game is to obtain more Volgare points. The players will gain VP from reading manuscripts
column11: looking for important documents like the Canticle of the Sun or "The Riddle from Verona". Players can also gain VP by improving their social status
column12: for example
column13: if the merchant becomes a banker or the Friar becomes a Benedictine Monk or the Cardinal becomes Camerlengo or Pope. Moreover
column14: VP can be gotten with money and with the support of Politicians
column15: Noblemen
column16: Abbesses
column17:
and the Amanuensis.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/mAyx-NXFYvTj6Dz-YKormQ__original/img/Ch4TL5VvsCZGDrEfAvpA65Drym8=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic778029.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/mAyx-NXFYvTj6Dz-YKormQ__thumb/img/k56Pz_BhVJ2ojAzx9Z5BeZth3pQ=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic778029.jpg@3.6238@120@2@5

column1: 233@Dawn of the Zeds (Third Edition)@The postcards in every local drug store read
column2: "Welcome to Fabulous Farmingdale!"
column3: an ad campaign that was the brainchild of Mayor Hernandez (who coincidentally employed his wife's public relations firm to market their community). But right now
column4: things are far from fabulous in Farmingdale and
column5: for once
column6: everyone isn't blaming the Mayor. Some kind of virus or poison is turning ordinary people into vicious
column7: zombie-like killers. It is not clear how the disease spreads (though it seems that physical contact is certainly one way)
column8:
but it is obvious what the illness does to its victims.

These undead
column9: nicknamed "Zeds" from the local newscasts as the acronym for "Zombie Epidemic Disease
column10: " are now converging on your corner of the world around Farmingdale. As best you can tell
column11: you have been left to your own devices to stop them while the National Guard organizes a relief column
column12: but that could take days
column13: perhaps weeks
column14: for them to fight their way to you and until then
column15:
what can you do?

With little choice between survival and a gruesome (un)death
column16: you realize that you must coordinate the defense of the town of Farmingdale and its surrounding villages. You must lead the good citizens and emerging heroes of these communities to halt the Zeds' advances by (re)killing them
column17: attempt to coordinate the discovery of a cure to this vile scourge
column18:
and preserve as much of the area and as many of its inhabitants as possible. There's no time to lose...

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/WnREnwi-pR72tqDa9-1zBQ__original/img/o31sWdbMtQFA0cZQtpx1pB7if-E=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic4929411.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/WnREnwi-pR72tqDa9-1zBQ__thumb/img/-bedWb_t582j4ghHjJpE7QCE0IU=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4929411.jpg@3.8099@120@1@5

column1: 234@Indonesia@Judging by the smirk on the face of the Sultan of Solo
column2: the businessman from North Sumatra has just made a mistake. And a costly one at that
column3: too. He has paid way too much for merging his rubber company with the Sultan’s extensive rubber plantations: there are no ships in the area to transport the rubber to the booming cities of Java. And the Sultan is now dripping in cash — he can bribe city authorities so that his ships will gain preferential access to those ports where they are competing. Or he might invest in building an oil imperium. But wait — what’s that young fellow over there up to? Buying all the shipping lines? That might change the outlook … considerably
column4:
in fact … let’s see…

Indonesia is a game in which two to five players build up an economy
column5: trying to acquire the most money. Players acquire production companies
column6: which produce goods (rice
column7: spices
column8: microwaveable meals
column9: rubber
column10: and oil)
column11: and shipping companies
column12: which deliver goods to cities. As cities receive goods
column13: they grow
column14: increasing their demands. Production companies earn money for each good delivered to a city
column15: up to the city's capacity
column16: but they must pay shipping companies for the distance traveled
column17: even if they end up losing money. Players can research advantages
column18: like greater shipping capacity or the ability to merge companies
column19:
possibly stealing ownership of lucrative plantations or shipping routes by buying out other players.

Players keep their money hidden
column20: trying to accumulate the most by the end of the third era. When only one type of a company is left
column21: an era ends. New eras bring new cities
column22: companies
column23: and types of goods. At the end of the third era
column24: the player with the most money wins. However
column25: money earned from the last round of operations (selling/shipping goods) counts double
column26:
so it can be important to control the timing.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/dMKwaRT7SYvukMuz6A8cxQ__original/img/ujxqaJuxawHp28WMvjv4JyUp0ac=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic93485.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/dMKwaRT7SYvukMuz6A8cxQ__thumb/img/RCh0FVF5BT9-ATms0Wc_6hs2z5I=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic93485.jpg@3.979@240@2@5

column1: 235@Wendake@"Wendake" is the name that the Wyandot people use for their traditional territory. This population
column2: also known as the Huron Nation
column3: lived in the Great Lakes region
column4: together with the tribes who formed the Iroquois Confederacy
column5: and many others. In this game
column6: you will explore the traditions and everyday life of these tribes during the 1756–1763 period
column7:
when the Seven Years’ War between the French and the English took place in these territories.

But this white man’s war is only a marginal aspect of the game; the focus is on life in the native villages
column8: fields
column9: and forests. In this game
column10: you won’t find the traditional tipis
column11: which were used by southwestern tribes who moved their camps to follow the bison herds. The natives of the Great Lakes were more sedentary
column12: living in longhouses. The women farmed beans
column13: corn
column14: and pumpkins
column15: while the men hunted beavers in the forests
column16:
mainly to sell their pelts as leather.

In Wendake
column17: you step into the shoes of the chief of a Native American tribe. You will have to manage the most important aspects of your tribe’s daily existence
column18: thereby earning points on the Economic
column19: Military
column20: Ritual
column21: and Mask tracks. The core of the game is the action selection mechanism: you will have the opportunity to choose better and better actions over 7 years (i.e.
column22: rounds)
column23:
and the winner will be the chief who finds the best combinations of actions and uses them to lead their tribe to prosperity!

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/N_oaV30_ImihsgPhYAUyiQ__original/img/BfzNBdQu-iHq3nA9Dfnwhz06EyQ=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic4110410.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/N_oaV30_ImihsgPhYAUyiQ__thumb/img/5Ux0lbcU6kZPSGW3SpKFQhdw9ww=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4110410.jpg@3.5895@120@1@4

column1: 236@Star Wars: Outer Rim@Take to the stars and become a living legend in Star Wars: Outer Rim
column2: a game of bounty hunters
column3: mercenaries
column4:
and smugglers for 1-4 players!

In Outer Rim
column5: you take on the role of an underworld denizen
column6: setting out to make your mark on the galaxy. You'll travel the outer rim in your personal ship
column7: hire legendary Star Wars characters to join your crew
column8:
and try to become the most famous (or infamous) outlaw in the galaxy!

But it won't be easy since the warring factions of the galaxy roam the outer rim
column9: hunting down the scum that have proven to be a thorn in their side
column10:
and other scoundrels looking to make their mark see you as the perfect target to bring down to bolster their own reputation. Do you have what it takes to survive in the outer rim and become a living legend?

In more detail
column11: a game of Outer Rim takes place over a series of turns that sees players taking dangerous jobs
column12: tracking down bounties
column13: upgrading their ship
column14: and more
column15: all in service of gaining more and more fame. Regardless of the path you take to get there
column16: your goal is to gain ten fame
column17: which can come from a variety of sources
column18: such as completing your character's personal goal
column19: collecting on bounties and jobs
column20: delivering illegal cargo
column21: taking down patrols from the various factions struggling over the galaxy
column22:
and enjoying the finer things in life by purchasing luxury items with your hard-earned credits.

While the path to victory may be different for scoundrels finding their way in the Outer Rim
column23: everyone starts from the bottom with a simple starship. Your player board not only tracks your fame progress
column24: but also contains slots for your ship
column25: your character card
column26: gear
column27: reputation
column28: modifications
column29: jobs
column30:
and bounties.

column1: 237@6 nimmt!@In 6 nimmt!
column2: a.k.a. Category 5 and many other names
column3:
you want to score as few points as possible.

To play the game
column4: you shuffle the 104 number cards
column5: lay out four cards face-up to start the four rows
column6: then deal ten cards to each player. Each turn
column7: players simultaneously choose and reveal a card from their hand
column8: then add the cards to the rows
column9: with cards being placed in ascending order based on their number; specifically
column10: each card is placed in the row that ends with the highest number that's below the card's number. When the sixth card is placed in a row
column11:
the owner of that card claims the other five cards and the sixth card becomes the first card in a new row.

In addition to a number from 1 to 104
column12: each card has a point value. After finishing ten rounds
column13: players tally their score and see whether the game ends. (Category 5 ends when a player has a score greater than 74
column14: for example
column15: while 6 nimmt! ends when someone tops 66.) When this happens
column16:
the player with the fewest points wins!

6 nimmt! works with 2-10 players
column17: and the dynamics of gameplay change the more players that you have. One variant for the game has you use 34 cards
column18: 44 cards
column19: 54 cards
column20: etc. (instead of all 104 cards) when you have three
column21: four
column22: five
column23: etc. number of players. This change allows you to know which cards are in play
column24:
thereby allowing you to track which cards have been played and (theoretically) make better choices as to which card to play when.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/JFhLVSRFQ2mtWRNHgbZ3Wg__original/img/9fIiXGmstIfL7rLvn9pNXM1Bw6Q=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic2602138.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/JFhLVSRFQ2mtWRNHgbZ3Wg__thumb/img/jqJgikalfbCRPAMpjq4bWH0sj08=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic2602138.jpg@1.201@45@2@10

column1: 238@Grand Austria Hotel@In the thick of the Viennese modern age
column2: exquisite cafés are competing for customers. Inspiring artists
column3: important politicians
column4: and tourists from all over the world are populating Vienna and in need of a hotel room. This is your opportunity to turn your little café into a world famous hotel. Hire staff
column5: fulfill the wishes of your guests
column6:
and gain the emperor's favor. Only then will your café become the Grand Austria Hotel.

The start player rolls the dice
column7: sorting them by the rolled number and placing them on the corresponding action spaces. On a turn
column8: a player chooses one of the six actions and carries it out. The number of the available dice in the corresponding action spaces determines how much the player gets from the action. They then remove one of the dice and can carry out additional actions. With the different actions
column9: a player can get the necessary drinks and dishes
column10: prepare the rooms
column11:
or hire staff.

But no hotel can grow without guests. To choose wisely which guests to attract and to complete their orders brings some important bonus actions. The staff cards also have different advantages
column12: but the game ends after seven rounds and no player can do everything they want
column13:
so whoever makes the right decisions and finds the best way to create bonus actions will win.

With 116 different cards and a new set-up in each game
column14:
Grand Austria Hotel provides a huge replay value. Each game stands on its own and demands new tactics and strategies.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/d4It-gdWY4GZVYSjbq20gQ__original/img/q--Mlcev3k1VtDfk37jK_v26750=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic2728138.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/d4It-gdWY4GZVYSjbq20gQ__thumb/img/b_KgnMcnGbqF9xc3DdfLvVT-6Wo=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic2728138.jpg@3.215@120@2@4

column1: 239@Pulsar 2849@It is the year 2849
column2:
and humanity has harnessed the power of the pulsars. Now we must find a way to distribute this power throughout the stars.
In this Euro-style game
column3: players explore space
column4: claim pulsars
column5: and discover technologies that will help them build energy-distribution infrastructure on a cosmic scale. Dice are used to purchase actions
column6:
and players choose their dice from a communal pool. There are many paths to victory so you can blaze your own trail to a bright future.

Draft dice to explore the universe in Pulsar 2849. Game is only 8 rounds long.
Each round
column7: roll dice based on the number of players
column8: sort them based on their values
column9:
then draft dice to take actions.

Possible actions
    â–¡ Fly your survey ship
    â–¡ take a Gyrodyne
    â–¡ Develop a Pulsar
    â–¡ Build one or more energy transmitter vectors
    â–¡ Patent a technology
    â–¡ Buy a dice modifier
    â–¡ Complete a special project in your HQ and unlock Gate Run

Players score points each round based on what they've discovered and explored
column10:
and everyone has common goals that they want to achieve.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/6TOzhqw0BXNxbUZCl0k1sg__original/img/tj-4BHcZxjUmiJpMnPCxXF1g0YY=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic6285702.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/6TOzhqw0BXNxbUZCl0k1sg__thumb/img/mwWM79qLTJj9ZoGThWiu6ljbtiw=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic6285702.jpg@3.3494@90@2@4

column1: 240@Onitama@Onitama is a two-player
column2: perfect information abstract game with a random starting set-up. On a 5x5 board
column3: both players start with five pawns on their side
column4:
with the main pawn in the middle.

Each player has two open cards that each display a possible move for any of her pieces. There is a fifth card that cannot be used by either player. On a player's turn
column5: she chooses one of her cards
column6: moves one of her pieces according to the chosen card
column7: then replaces the card she used with the fifth card. The other player then chooses one of his cards
column8: moves accordingly
column9: and exchanges that card with this fifth card — which is
column10: of course
column11:
the card the first player just used.

Moving onto one of the opponent's pawns removes that pawn from the game. Taking the opponent's main pawn
column12: or moving your main pawn into your opponent's main pawn's starting space
column13:
wins you the game.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/GJKuOCy5HGAYgVH_Rei5mA__original/img/oRsIxp72iv58128KFdqvjG6Gz64=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic7070194.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/GJKuOCy5HGAYgVH_Rei5mA__thumb/img/Q3W4poMS4btD-HZLervgqbSCtmE=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic7070194.jpg@1.6755@20@2@2

column1: 241@Hardback@Hardback is a deck-building word game
column2: a prequel to Paperback. As an aspiring 19th-century novelist
column3: you work to pen your next masterpiece
column4: earning prestige along the way.  Specialize your deck in certain genres to exploit card combinations
column5:
and press your luck to draw extra cards — but make sure you can still string a word together!

Players build a deck of letters with various powers and race to 60 fame points to win.  Some of the features:


    No wilds in your deck - any card can be wild.
    Push your luck for more cards with the Ink system.
    Match genre colors to gain bonus abilities on your cards.
    New "Timeless Classic" letter cards stay in play until an opponent uses them.


In addition to the competitive race mode for 2-5 players
column6: the base game includes several variant rules
column7: including Literary Awards
column8: Adverts
column9: Player Powers
column10: and Events; and a co-op mode for 1-4 players
column11: in which players join forces against one of four simulated opponents
column12:
each of which is proficient in a different deck genre.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/QKo6ujrTGJBgXoG1oEuoAQ__original/img/bPquvg26GUQ1icN94avjE3RY2PE=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic3968823.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/QKo6ujrTGJBgXoG1oEuoAQ__thumb/img/owRLmPoUxcdR0JBDl5BzZ3RFLhI=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic3968823.jpg@2.1273@90@1@5

column1: 242@The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport@You and your adventuring companions are just returning to the bustling city of Greyport after your latest adventure. You are all looking forward to relaxing and spending some of your hard-earned loot at The Red Dragon Inn. The party will have to wait
column2: though
column3:
because the city is under attack by evil monsters!

Battle for Greyport is a cooperative deck-building game based on the characters and world of The Red Dragon Inn. You will travel to important locations around the city
column4: fighting epic battles and recruiting whatever heroes and items you can along the way. Each encounter presents more opportunities to improve your deck
column5:
but also brings more dire foes for you to face!

With five playable characters
column6: seven different scenarios
column7: and an assortment of variants
column8: you can have a new game every time
column9:
adjusting the game’s difficulty as you improve.

Will you defend the city from the monsters and defeat their nefarious boss
column10:
or will the city (and the tavern!) be overrun?

The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport also contains two items for use with any of the standalone The Red Dragon Inn titles: Chronos the Time Mage character deck and Drog's Special Reserve drink card. The Deluxe Edition also includes Firewater of the Fire Mage and The Iridescent Wyvern.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/FWc5Q9GGg60MifdaLf4Kxw__original/img/PILl7P9HNw2LNS0lOMbysFC5z5g=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic3246529.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/FWc5Q9GGg60MifdaLf4Kxw__thumb/img/jQMxl8CnlctzR_46oeQrZHZlc6Q=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic3246529.jpg@2.9167@100@2@5

column1: 243@Manila@Barges
column2: freight and profits are what it's all about in Manila
column3: a speculative contest for 3-5 players. Goods shipments
column4: intended for transport along sea routes
column5: are in danger of gathering dust in the warehouses or being lost at sea in a storm. While the players speculate about success and failure
column6:
the ultimate fate of the ships will be determined by the dice.

There are four shipments that need to get to Manila - jade
column7: ginseng
column8: silk and nutmeg. A round begins with an initial auction to become harbour master. If you win
column9: you'll be allowed to buy a share of one of the shipments
column10: choose which three shipments you'd like to take down river and how likely they are to make it to their destination in the harbour. If they make it to Manila
column11: their share price will increase. The aim of the game is to bet on the outcome of these shipments
column12:
with dice ultimately determining their fate. How many of the three boats will make it and which ones? Would you like to provide insurance against possible failed ships or perhaps you think pirates will snatch a chance to take control? Manila is a fun family game that takes minutes to learn and brings the river boats of the Philippines to life!

244@Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men@Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

In this game

column4: Wolverine
column5: Spider-Man
column6: and more — being represented by custom-tooled dice; each team must be composed of up to 20 dice

column8: which show the special abilities for the characters based on the die rolls. Different versions of these cards will be available in booster packs
column9: allowing for more customization of your team. Players use these dice to collect energy

column12: each player brings two basic action cards to the game

which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase these cards. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

The Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men starter set comes with 44 custom dice
column14: 38 cards

column16:
and a core rulebook. Booster packs include two dice with two matching character cards.

column1:
245@Inis@Inis is a game deeply rooted in Celtic history and lore in which players win by being elected King of the Island (Inis). Players can try to achieve one of three different victory conditions:


     Leadership: Be the leader — i.e.
column2:
have more clan figures than any other player — of territories containing at least six opponents' clans.
     Land: Have your clans present in at least six different territories.
     Religion: Have your clans present in territories that collectively contain at least six sanctuaries.


Over the course of the game
column3: players also earn deeds
column4: typically chanted by bards or engraved by master crafters
column5: that reduce by one the magic total of six for any condition. While one victory condition is enough to claim the title of King
column6: a game of experienced players usually has a tight balance of power
column7:
emphasizing the leadership of the capital of the island.

At the start of each round
column8: players draft a hand of four action cards (with 13 action cards for three players and 17 for four players) during the Assembly. Action cards not played at the end of one season are not held for the next. Players also have access to leader cards for the territories that allow it and where they were elected leader during the assembly. Each Assembly reallocates those cards. Finally
column9: they collect "epic tales" cards that depict the deeds of the ancient Irish gods and heroes
column10: like Cuchulainn
column11: the Dagda
column12: Lugh and many others. These will be kept and used to inspire the clans and achieve extraordinary feats...under the right circumstances. The cards provide a variety of actions: adding clans
column13: moving clans
column14: building/exploring
column15:
and special actions.

Careful drafting
column16: hand management
column17: bluffing (especially once players understand the importance of passing their turn)
column18: good timing
column19: and a precise understanding of the balance of power are the keys to victory. After a discovery game you'll be ready for a full and epic game
column20:
where an undisputed player will be king by the Assembly for his merit and wisdom.

While Inis has "dudes" that are "on a map"
column21: it's a beginner's mistake to play this as a battle game because eliminating other clans reduces your chances of scoring a Leadership victory condition. Peace among different clans
column22: with or without a clear territory leader
column23: is the usual outcome of a clan's movement. Battles will occur
column24: of course
column25: as the Celtic clans can be unruly and a good player will listen to his clan's people (i.e.
column26: his hand of cards). That battle aspect is reflected in the clan's miniatures representing warriors. Woodsmen
column27: shepherds and traders complete the set of twelve minis for each player; these occupations have no impact on the game
column28:
but give it flavor.

column1: 246@Above and Below@Your last village was ransacked by barbarians. You barely had time to pick up the baby and your favorite fishing pole before they started the burning and pillaging. You wandered over a cruel desert
column2: braved frozen peaks
column3: and even paddled a log across a rough sea
column4: kicking at the sharks whenever they got too close
column5:
the baby strapped tightly to your back.

Then you found it! The perfect place to make your new home. But as soon as you had the first hut built
column6: you discovered a vast network of caverns underground
column7: brimming with shiny treasures
column8: rare resources
column9:
and untold adventure. How could you limit your new village to the surface? You immediately start organizing expeditions and building houses underground as well as on the surface.

With any luck
column10: you'll build a village even stronger than your last-- strong enough
column11: even
column12:
to turn away the barbarians the next time they come knocking.

Above and Below is a mashup of town-building and storytelling where you and up to three friends compete to build the best village above and below ground. In the game
column13: you send your villagers to perform jobs like exploring the cave
column14: harvesting resources
column15: and constructing houses. Each villager has unique skills and abilities
column16: and you must decide how to best use them. You have your own personal village board
column17:
and you slide the villagers on this board to various areas to indicate that they've been given jobs to do. Will you send Hanna along on the expedition to the cave? Or should she instead spend her time teaching important skills to one of the young villagers?

A great cavern lies below the surface
column18: ready for you to explore-- this is where the storytelling comes in. When you send a group of villagers to explore the depths
column19: one of your friends reads what happens to you from a book of paragraphs. You'll be given a choice of how to react
column20: and a lot will depend on which villagers you brought on the expedition
column21: and who you're willing to sacrifice to succeed. The book of paragraphs is packed with encounters of amazing adventure
column22:
randomly chosen each time you visit the cavern.

At the end of the game
column23:
the player with the most well-developed village wins!

The Kickstarter version of the game included the following items which are not found in the Retail version:

     Villager Tool tokens
     Lost Villagers
     Swamp Villagers
     Exclusive Stretch goals:
     Creature Villagers
     Quest Tokens
     Underforest Tokens and PDF story book
     Desert Labyrinth tokens and PDF story book 
     Wooden Goods


This collection of items can be found in Above and Below: Expanded Edition Exclusives

column1: 247@Fields of Green@Fields of Green takes place in the second half of the 20th century. Players take the role of farm owners trying to expand their property and business. By adding fields
column2: livestock and facilities
column3:
they build an economic engine that will bring them closer to victory.

Fields of Green
column4: inspired by Among the Stars
column5: is played over four rounds (years) during which players draft cards and add them to their ever-expanding farms. At the end of each year comes the harvest season when they must water their fields
column6: feed their livestock
column7:
and pay maintenance costs in order to receive valuable resources that will allow them to further expand in the next year.

Through various means
column8: player eventually convert their wealth to victory points
column9:
and the player who gathers the most by the end of the fourth year wins.

column1: 248@Welcome To...@As an architect in Welcome To...
column2: you want to build the best new town in the United States of the 1950s by adding resources to a pool
column3: hiring employees
column4:
and more.

Welcome To... plays like a roll-and-write dice game in which you mark results on a score-sheet...but without dice. Instead you flip cards from three piles to make three different action sets with both a house number and a corresponding action from which everyone chooses one. You use the number to fill in a house on your street in numerical order. Then you take the action to increase the point value of estates you build or score points at the end for building parks and pools. Players also have the option of taking actions to alter or duplicate their house numbers. And everyone is racing to be the first to complete public goals. There's lots to do and many paths to becoming the best suburban architect in Welcome To...!

Because of the communal actions
column5: game play is simultaneous and thus supports large groups of players. With many varying strategies and completely randomized action sets
column6:
no two games will feel the same!

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/g4XmxyKhNVdhC3QPd1purQ__original/img/pb6XFQZFUNOr6OPysOHB3usVDFk=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic3761012.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/g4XmxyKhNVdhC3QPd1purQ__thumb/img/e3bCyIvM1IOGFYnKGj2jIn5mbKY=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic3761012.jpg@1.8273@25@1@100

column1: 249@Radlands@Radlands is a competitive
column2:
dueling card game about identifying fiercely powerful card synergies.

Act as the leader of your post apocalyptic group of survivors in a tooth-and-nail fight to protect your three camps from a vicious rival tribe. If all of them are destroyed
column3:
you lose the game.

The main resource in the game is water. You will spend it to play people and events
column4: and to use the abilities of cards you already have on the table. People protect your camps and provide useful abilities
column5:
while events are powerful effects that take time to pay off.

Both players draw cards from the same deck. All cards can either be played to the table or discarded for quick “junk” effects. To win
column6:
you will need to manage your cards and water wisely.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/YpQUtpxNtDHBF5eVcwzBtQ__original/img/br-kw0KuyBfH1mrxZ0kgVrF9UMc=/0x0/filters:format(png)/pic6478338.png@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/YpQUtpxNtDHBF5eVcwzBtQ__thumb/img/tN06HL-O6O-ayKHxEio9xYoJym0=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic6478338.png@2.2404@40@2@2

column1:
250@Techno Bowl: Arcade Football Unplugged@TECH? NO! 
Forget about expensive game systems
column2: emulators
column3: disconnected online games
column4: and high-priced yearly roster updates. TECHNO BOWL takes everything you love about arcade and video game football classics like Tecmo Bowl
column5: NFL Blitz
column6:
and Madden and puts it all on the tabletop.

1UP
And as if that isn’t cool enough
column7: it also gives you a feature that gamers have long asked for but never gotten… until now! What is it you ask? As a coach in TECHNO BOWL
column8:
you will design your own formations and plays. That’s right. Let me say it again. You get to design your own formations and plays.

And I’m not talking about choosing several formation cards
column9: lining up elements on a chart
column10:
or utilizing some other abstraction. This is putting the power to effortlessly create real football formations and plays into your hands.

ZERO DOWN TIME
Thanks to the BOX SPORTS ENGINE
column11: there is almost zero down time in the game [except for half time and timeouts of course!]. Coaches are constantly involved
column12: and the on-field players are always interacting with one another as skill checks and ever evolving plays result in: free actions
column13: reactions
column14: read-and-reacts
column15: and offensive and defensive adjustments. Add to that real world timers for setting up formations and selecting plays
column16:
and you have a truly dynamic fast-paced tabletop football experience.

UNPARALLELED FOOTBALL GAMEPLAY
TECHNO BOWL delivers that authentic football feel like no game before it. Establish the running game by punching it in between the tackles or tossing it to a back for an outside sweep. Launch an air offensive while sitting in the pocket or throwing on the run with laser accurate throws directly to the receiver or exciting route passes where you lead the receiver in hopes of beating the coverage. Defense can run man
column17: zone
column18: and mixed defensive packages and bring the blitz. Oh
column19:
can it bring the blitz!

No matter which strategy you choose
column20: the gameplay will look
column21: feel
column22:
and flow like a real football play.

OPTIONS
TECHNO BOWL is all about options
column23: and there’s a game mode
column24: team
column25:
and play style for everyone. You even have the option to run an option!

MODES
There are five different modes of play. Each of these brings a different experience to the table.

- TECHNO is 7-vs-7 with no skills and no field goals.
- ALL TECHNO is 7-vs-7 with skills but no field goals.
- INFERNO! It’s ALL TECHNO with more awesome and fire! [more later]
- PRO is 8-vs-8 with no skills but includes field goal rules.
- ALL PRO is 8-vs-8 with skills and field goal rules.

Each of these modes offers a completely different game experience
column26:
and I know what you’re thinking. How does adding an extra couple of players to the field [and the ability to kick field goals] equate with an entirely different mode? Trust me. Having that extra player on both sides of the ball quite literally changes everything.

MAD SKILLS
When playing in modes that utilize special skills and abilities
column27:
coaches will have access to three types of players:

- IMPACT
- STAR
- SUPERSTAR

These players will come equipped with one or more of the 26 skills found in the game. That count of 26 skills doesn’t even include core fundamentals or INFERNO MODE specific skills.

SKILL
Speaking of skills
column28: TECHNO BOWL is a game of skill and not a random ‘dice fest’. The 2d6 rolls used for skill checks mean that coaches won’t fall prey to straight-line probabilities or random chaos. Winning is about getting the right match and modifiers to deliver a high percentage roll
column29: having a plan when you get an unusually poor result
column30: and knowing the right time to make a high risk roll for a shot at a very high payoff. Of course
column32: play calling
column33:
and player positioning create these opportunities.

PLAYMAKER DIE
The PLAYMAKER die powers some of the special skills in the game like stiff arms and spin moves allowing for sophisticated passive abilities to be triggered without the need for complex rules.

TEAMS
There are 32 teams in the MORE FUN LEAGUE [MFL]
column34: and each of these has its own unique play style. This means that you’re not just trying to get into the head of the coach that’s sitting across the table from you
column35:
but that you have to take into consideration the strengths and weaknesses of the players on the specific rosters that you and your opponent are using.

PLAYER SKILL RATINGS
The player skill rating system ensures that coaches and spectators will know how well or poorly a player performs fundamental actions by simply looking at the jersey number! No need to look at charts or extended stat lines. The league skill cap manages team composition so that you are never taxed to remember an insane number of special abilities or which players have them. Coaches get beaten by other coaches and NOT the rules.

Welcome to the More Fun League!

column1: 251@Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King@Isle of Skye is one of the most beautiful places in the world
column2: with soft sand beaches
column3: gently sloping hills
column4:
and impressive  mountains. The landscape of Isle of Skye is breathtaking and fascinates everyone.

In the tile-laying game Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
column5:
2–5 players are chieftains of famous clans and want to build their kingdoms to score as many points as possible—but in each game only four of the sixteen scoring tiles will be scored.

Thanks to the scoring tiles
column6: each game is different and leads to different tactics and strategies
column7: but having enough money is useful no matter what else is going on. Managing that money can be tricky
column8: though. Each turn
column9: each player places two area tiles in front of them and sets the selling price for the tiles. Setting a high price is great
column10: but only so long as someone actually pays the price because if no one opts to buy
column11:
then the seller must buy the tiles at the price they previously requested.

In the end
column12:
the player with the best kingdom—and not the richest player—becomes the sovereign of the island.

column1: 252@DinoGenics@DinoGenics is a competitive game for two to five players
column2:
in which each player attempts to build and run their own successful dinosaur park.

Each player is the head of their own corporation with access to their own private island resort.  Each season
column3: players assign agents to the mainland to compete over DNA and other limited resources.  Once collected
column4: players can build fences
column5: various park facilities and populate their parks with dinosaurs.  Parks with the most prestigious dinosaurs will attract the most visitors.  But beware; if dinosaurs are neglected or improperly penned
column6:
they will attempt to escape and spread havoc through the entire park.

Use all the tools at your disposal; DNA splice mutant dinosaurs
column7: exploit the Black Market or just try to run an honest park
column8:
the choices are yours.

Do you have what it takes to lead your corporation to victory?

column1: 253@Century: Spice Road@Century: Spice Road is the first in a series of games that explores the history of each century with spice-trading as the theme for the first installment.  In Century: Spice Road
column2: players are caravan leaders who travel the famed silk road to deliver spices to the far reaches of the continent for fame and glory. Each turn

players perform one of four actions:


     Establish a trade route (by taking a market card)
     Make a trade or harvest spices (by playing a card from hand)
     Fulfill a demand (by meeting a victory point card's requirements and claiming it)
     Rest (by taking back into your hand all of the cards you've played)


The last round is triggered once a player has claimed their fifth victory point card
column4:
then whoever has the most victory points wins.

column2:

Belfort is a worker placement game with area majority scoring in each district as well as for each type of worker. Buildings give you influence in the districts as well as income

and help build the city of Belfort!

column1:
255@Munchkin@				
				
					Publisher's Description

Go down in the dungeon. Kill everything you meet. Backstab your friends and steal their stuff. Grab the treasure and run.

Admit it. You love it.

This award-winning card game
column2: designed by Steve Jackson
column3: captures the essence of the dungeon experience... with none of that stupid roleplaying stuff. You and your friends compete to kill monsters and grab magic items. And what magic items! Don the Horny Helmet and the Boots of Butt-Kicking. Wield the Staff of Napalm... or maybe the Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment. Start by slaughtering the Potted Plant and the Drooling Slime
column4:
and work your way up to the Plutonium Dragon...

And it's illustrated by John Kovalic! Fast-playing and silly
column5: Munchkin can reduce any roleplaying group to hysteria. And
column6: while they're laughing
column7:
you can steal their stuff.

				
				
					Other

Part of the Munchkin series.

Munchkin is a satirical card game based on the clichés and oddities of Dungeons and Dragons and other role-playing games. Each player starts at level 1 and the winner is the first player to reach level 10. Players can acquire familiar D&D style character classes during the game which determine to some extent the cards they can play.

There are two types of cards - treasure and encounters. Each turn the current players 'kicks down the door' - drawing an encounter card from the deck. Usually this will involve battling a monster. Monsters have their own levels and players must try and overcome it using the levels
column8:
weapons and powers they have acquired during the game or run away. Other players can chose to help the player or hinder by adding extra monsters to the encounter. Defeating a monster will usually result in drawing treasure cards and acquiring levels.  Being defeated by a monster results in "bad stuff" which usually involves losing levels and treasure.

In May 2010
column9: Steve Jackson Games made the "big announcement." Many rules and cards were changed. See The Great 2010 Munchkin Changeover for details. Of note to Munchkin fans
column10: the Kneepads of Allure card
column11: which had been removed in the 14th printing
column12:
was added back to the game but modified to be less powerful.

and the Munchkin

column1: 256@Tigris & Euphrates@Regarded by many as Reiner Knizia's masterpiece
column2: Tigris & Euphrates is set in the ancient fertile crescent with players building civilizations through tile placement. Players are given four different leaders: farming
column3: trading
column4: religion
column5: and government. The leaders are used to collect victory points in these same categories. However
column6: your score at the end of the game is the number of points in your weakest category
column7: which encourages players not to get overly specialized. Conflict arises when civilizations connect on the board
column8: i.e.
column9: external conflicts
column10:
with only one leader of each type surviving such a conflict. Leaders can also be replaced within a civilization through internal conflicts.

Starting in the Mayfair edition from 2008
column11: Tigris & Euphrates included a double-sided game board and extra components for playing an advanced version of the game. This "ziggurat expansion"
column12: initially released as a separate item in Germany for those who already owned the base game
column13: is a special monument that extends across five spaces of the board. The monument can be built if a player has a cross of five civilization tokens of the same color by discarding those five tokens and replacing them with the ziggurat markers
column14: placing a ziggurat tower upon the middle tile. The five ziggurat markers cannot be destroyed. All rules regarding monuments apply to the ziggurat monument as well. If your king is inside the kingdom of the ziggurat
column15:
you will get one victory point in a color of your choice at the end of your turn.

Some versions of Tigris & Euphrates are listed as being for 2-4 players
column16:
while others incorrectly state that they're for 3-4 players. Tigris & Euphrates is part of what is sometimes called Reiner Knizia's tile-laying trilogy.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/soAzNVWglCdVBacNjoCTJw__original/img/HClVZy9phFP-NPte4UBQpclsaHU=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic2338267.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/soAzNVWglCdVBacNjoCTJw__thumb/img/0UPEyOaSFyqEH1ikrSig_218RQ0=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic2338267.jpg@3.5026@90@2@4

column1: 257@Merchants of the Dark Road@After half a year of daylight
column2: we must now prepare for the dark season. The roads will be treacherous but they will still need to be braved by a select few in order to keep our cities thriving. In Merchants of the Dark Road
column3: you are one of these brave few merchants that travel the dangerous paths between cities. While the job is perilous
column4:
fame and fortune await.

Discover the capital city where most of your actions will take place using a rondel action system. Collect and produce items to add to your caravan
column5: or sell these items to local heroes and hire them to travel with you. Manipulate the market price of items
column6: visit the back alley sellers
column7:
or delve a nearby dungeon for magical items to gain the potential for even more coin and notoriety.

Gather lanterns to ease your passage along the dark roads as you guide your caravan to distant villages. Deliver goods and heroes to the best destinations and gain fame for your bravery! Balance the money you earn with the height of your fame because your final score after a number of game rounds will reflect the lowest of these two values.

After all
column8: what good is a purse full of the coin if the people don’t sing songs about you
column9:
and what good is a song with an empty mug of ale?

—description from the publisher

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/m0097WIpBdC7tdA-mVi5Fw__original/img/bd3RYiimI4iWs2w1u27_2w4ImOI=/0x0/filters:format(png)/pic5252479.png@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/m0097WIpBdC7tdA-mVi5Fw__thumb/img/vGQx16-veWt64dxdrQA8w2VlsHA=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic5252479.png@3.1653@120@1@4

column1: 258@Fantastic Factories@It's a manufacturing arms race! Compete against other players as you try to build the most efficient set of factories in the shortest time. You must carefully manage your blueprints
column2: train your workers
column3:
and manufacture as many goods as possible in order to achieve industrial dominance!

In Fantastic Factories
column4: you race to manufacture the most goods or build the most prestigious buildings. There are elements of dice rolling
column5: worker placement
column6: engine building
column7: resource management
column8: tableau building
column9: simultaneous play
column10: and some card drafting. Each round is split into two phases
column11:
the market phase and the work phase.

During the market phase
column12:
you choose to either acquire a new blueprint for free or pay to hire a contractor. Blueprints are used to construct new factories during the work phase. Contractors can be used to reinforce your strategy by providing resources or allowing you to roll additional dice. You need to be mindful of what cards are available in the marketplace and the strategies your opponents may be pursuing.

During the work phase
column13: all players simultaneously roll their dice and use their dice as workers to run factories. Factories start as blueprints and need to be constructed. Once constructed
column14: each factory can be used once each turn. Worker placement can happen in any order and figuring out the correct sequence can enable a powerful chain of actions. Additionally
column15:
you can build training facilities that allow you to manipulate the dice values of your workers. Each work phase is like solving a unique worker placement puzzle in order to optimize your output of resources and goods.

Once any player has manufactured 12 goods or constructed 10 buildings
column16: the game end is triggered and one additional and final round is played. The player with the most points wins (combination of building prestige and manufactured goods). With over 30 unique blueprints and countless synergies across buildings
column17:
each game is unique. Fantastic Factories offers a lot of replay value and satisfaction as players discover new factory engines with each game.

—description from the publisher

A large collection of solo puzzles have also been created for Fantastic Factories along with official tools to create more. This puzzle collection can be found in the BGG Play-By-Forum area.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/AzNYQ2o-SXBAHFpPPtRBIw__original/img/QSapQT41vJZkBMzXx5ZkTbuTVf8=/0x0/filters:format(png)/pic4095959.png@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/AzNYQ2o-SXBAHFpPPtRBIw__thumb/img/CkfTNq419k6DTJthFwPA5oKYoHE=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4095959.png@2.1842@60@1@5

column1:
259@At the Gates of Loyang@At the Gates of Loyang is a trading game in which you are able to produce goods by planting them and later selling them to customers. You can use the abilities of some helpers to increase your income or production.

Fields
column2: customers
column3: helpers
column4: and miscellaneous objects are represented by cards. Each player receives two of these cards per round distributed by a bidding/drawing mechanism in which you end up with one of the cards you draw and one of the cards of a public offer filled by all players. Additionally
column5:
to these cards you always receive one field for free each round.

Placing one good on a field fills the complete field with goods of this type. Each round
column6: one unit per field is harvested. After planting
column7: harvesting
column8: and distributing cards
column9: each player can use as many actions as he wants
column10: only limited by the number of his cards or the number of goods he owns. At the end of his turn
column11: he can invest the earned money on a scoring track
column12: where early money is worth more than late money. The game ends after a certain number of rounds
column13:
and the player who is first on the scoring track wins.

Online Play

     Yucata (turn-based)


@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/xnC5RT14H1CgAueR7VTPzw__original/img/oAJwaxaPahA0xfYEWqf3V2xc9x0=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic3601060.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/xnC5RT14H1CgAueR7VTPzw__thumb/img/xO8aUHS7cZPMJRg6gFXlP6LgZbw=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic3601060.jpg@3.1189@120@1@4

column1: 260@Roads & Boats@In Roads & Boats
column2: players start with a modest collection of donkeys
column3: geese
column4: boards
column5: and stone. With these few materials
column6: players work to develop their civilization. The emphasis in the game is logistical transport as you bring goods to producers to make new goods. But beware
column7: the only thing you own is what is on your transporters
column8: and anyone can use any production facility
column9:
or pick up any goods left behind.

In more detail
column10: this massive set of pieces looks more like a modular game kit than anything else. You get a several small hexes in a number of colors for terrain type; hundreds of little counters for the commodities that are produced and the locations where they're produced; wooden disks for all of the donkeys
column11: rafts
column12: trucks
column13: and other forms of transportation you can use; and a roll of acrylic with an erasable marker. The tiles are laid out in whatever scenario you wish to play
column14: and then the clear plastic is taped over the top to secure the entire board. Roads and bridges are drawn on the plastic and chits are placed in the hexes to form the playing surface. The idea is that your transportation units (at first
column15: a fleet of 3 donkeys) travel about and pick items that part produced. However
column16: the only thing that you own is that which is carried by your transports. So you might have a nice
column17: shiny
column18: new truck factory or a gold-filled mine
column19: but anyone can use it or take it
column20: if they collect the necessary components and can transport them to the factory. The ultimate goal is to collect wealth
column21: which is progressively more valuable and harder to manufacture: gold
column22: coins
column23:
or stock certificates; and also contribute to the game timer in the form of monument blocks for victory points.

Third edition (and later) player transporter tokens were upgraded to shaped wooden tokens.
For its 20th Anniversary
column24:
Roads & Boats has an edition that contains the &cetera expansion: Roads & Boats: 20th Anniversary Edition

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/V-uqqRB-Ybm6oD5jWv9cSw__original/img/pOBZTUAqNmdJzkhEuFkxxnaGedk=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic713985.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/V-uqqRB-Ybm6oD5jWv9cSw__thumb/img/mJ6WPCY8ub5LWFnpCnusv42WNhI=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic713985.jpg@4.1911@240@1@4

column1: 261@Raiders of the North Sea@Raiders of the North Sea is set in the central years of the Viking Age. As Viking warriors
column2: players seek to impress the Chieftain by raiding unsuspecting settlements. To do so
column3: players need to assemble a crew
column4: collect provisions
column5: and journey north to plunder gold
column6: iron and livestock. Glory can be found in battle
column7: even at the hands of the Valkyrie
column8:
so gather your warriors because it's raiding season!

To impress the Chieftain
column9: you need victory points (VPs)
column10: with those being acquired primarily by raiding settlements
column11: taking plunder
column12: and making offerings to the Chieftain. How you use your plunder is also vital to your success. Players take turns in clockwise order
column13: and on a turn you place a worker and resolve its action
column14: then pick up a different worker and resolve its action. Broadly speaking
column15:
those actions fall in one of two categories:


     Work: Having a good crew and enough provisions are vital to successful raiding
column16: so before making any raids
column17: players need to do some work to prepare their crew and collect supplies. This is all done in the village at the bottom of the game board
column18: with eight buildings offering various actions. You must first place your worker in an available building where no other worker is present
column19:
then pick up a different worker from a different building.



     Raid: Once players have hired enough crew and collected provisions
column20: you may choose to raid on your turn. To raid a settlement — whether a harbor
column21: outpost
column22: monastery or fortress — you need to meet three requirements: Having a large enough crew
column23: having enough provisions (along with gold for monasteries and fortresses
column24: and having a worker of the right color. Raiding offers various ways of scoring
column25: such as military strength
column26: plunder
column27: and Valkyries
column28:
which is how grey and white workers enter the game.


The game ends when only one fortress raid remains
column29: all Valkyrie have been removed
column30: or all offerings have been made

column1: 262@Troyes@In Troyes (pronounced "twah")
column2: players recreate four centuries of history of this famous city of the Champagne region of France. Each player manages their segment of the population (represented by a horde of dice) and their hand of cards
column3: which represent the three primary domains of the city:  religious
column4: military
column5:
and civil. Players can also offer cash to their opponents' populace in order to get a little moonlighting out of them — anything for more fame!

Make your underlings:


     work on the cathedral
     combat misfortune
     bustle about the city
     and other such tasks that are below your family's stature


•••

Many editions of Troyes released in 2016 or later include rules for a solo variant as well as four bonus cards originally released in 2011 as a promotional item. Versions released prior to this date contain rules only for games with 2-4 players.

column1: 263@Zoo Break@A modern
column2:
cooperative take on the classic zoo escape premise.

EMERGENCY! A computer malfunction at the Bedlam Zoo has short-circuited the gates for all the enclosures and the animals are escaping and making their way to the zoo exit. You will work together with your fellow zookeepers to round up all the animals and lock their enclosures before it's too late.

Zoo Break is a crisis-management game that requires dynamic and cooperative problem-solving. You will spend your turn deciding how to use limited actions to move about the board
column3: collect and trade supplies
column4: capture animals
column5: and lock cages
column6: all while evading injury and coping with other challenges caused by the animals marauding through the zoo. Escape and Move cards control the animals with maximum variability
column7:
leading to endlessly different game scenarios.

Success hinges on the keepers' ability to anticipate
column8: adapt
column9: and make strategic decisions
column10: applying their skills and resources to regain control of the zoo. It's complex and suspenseful enough to keep adults riveted
column11: but also playful and inviting to ambitious
column12:
game-loving kids. (Difficulty can also be regulated using a simple card selection mechanism at the start of the game.)

—description from the publisher

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/ZeDyZIQ4GCE9Hmdk0sZZIQ__original/img/PVmdyA02HuMvMx01ttpHVNH1Mzg=/0x0/filters:format(png)/pic4450350.png@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/ZeDyZIQ4GCE9Hmdk0sZZIQ__thumb/img/seHegPJ1ycqNHC17Qni9vs0M5t4=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4450350.png@2.25@45@2@5

column1: 264@Trajan@Set in ancient Rome
column2: Trajan is a development game in which players try to increase their influence and power in various areas of Roman life such as political influence
column3: trading
column4:
military dominion and other important parts of Roman culture.

The central mechanism of the game uses a system similar to that in Mancala or pit-and-pebbles games. In Trajan
column5: a player has six possible actions: building
column6: trading
column7: taking tiles from the forum
column8: using the military
column9: influencing the Senate
column10:
and placing Trajan tiles on his tableau.

At the start of the game
column11: each player has two differently colored pieces in each of the six sections (bowls) of his tableau. On a turn
column12: the player picks up all the pieces in one bowl and distributes them one-by-one in bowls in a clockwise order. Wherever the final piece is placed
column13: the player takes the action associated with that bowl; in addition
column14: if the colored pieces in that bowl match the colors shown on a Trajan tile next to the bowl (with tiles being placed at the start of the game and through later actions)
column15:
then the player takes the additional action shown on that tile.

What are you trying to do with these actions? Acquire victory points (VPs) in whatever ways are available to you – and since this is a Feld design
column16: you try to avoid being punished
column17: too. At the Forum you try to anticipate the demands of the public so that you can supply them what they want and not suffer a penalty. In the Senate you acquire influence which translates into votes on VP-related laws
column18: ideally snagging a law that fits your long-term plans. With the military
column19: you take control of regions in Europe
column20:
earning more points for those regions far from Rome.

All game components are language neutral
column21:
and the playing time is 30 minutes per player.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/djdeCr__iNV5rMnGnxNiaQ__original/img/-pxFp0FHDLLZK_hMT5kHG7IAQ7M=/0x0/filters:format(png)/pic4336095.png@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/djdeCr__iNV5rMnGnxNiaQ__thumb/img/jULoayRVuV3c8cRqKOPsf7oMO5w=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4336095.png@3.6534@120@2@4

column1: 265@That's Pretty Clever!@Choose your dice well in Ganz schön clever to enter them into the matching colored area
column2: put together tricky chain-scoring opportunities
column3: and rack up the points. The dice you don't use are as important as what you do because every die that's smaller than the chosen one can be used by the other players
column4:
keeping everyone in the game at all times.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/3-unuy5JW1cC8C6EUBNiOA__original/img/YJRIGmJmT0XuhRbOmLN8VdLfEec=/0x0/filters:format(jpeg)/pic4410877.jpg@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/3-unuy5JW1cC8C6EUBNiOA__thumb/img/6lLy1-ra8knFDyG3FznGUp6WK-M=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic4410877.jpg@1.8789@30@1@4

column1: 266@Kingsburg@In Kingsburg
column2:
players are Lords sent from the King to administer frontier territories.

The game takes place over five years
column3: a total of 20 turns.  In every year
column4: there are 3 production seasons for collecting resources
column5: building structures
column6: and training troops.  Every fourth turn is the winter
column7: in which all the players must fight an invading army.  Each player must face the invaders
column8:
so this is not a cooperative game.

The resources to build structures and train troops are collected by influencing the advisers in the King's Council.  Players place their influence dice on members of the Council. The player with the lowest influence dice sum will be the first one to choose where to spend his/her influence; this acts as a way of balancing poor dice rolling. Even with a very unlucky roll
column9:
a clever player can still come out from the Council with a good number of resources and/or soldiers.

Each adviser on the King's Council will award different resources or allocate soldiers
column10: victory points
column11:
and other advantages to the player who was able to influence him/her for the current turn.

At the end of five years
column12:
the player who best developed his assigned territory and most pleased the King through the Council is the winner.

Many alternate strategies are possible to win: will you go for the military way
column13: disregarding economic and prestige buildings
column14: or will you aim to complete the big Cathedral to please the King?   Will you use the Merchant's Guild to gain more influence in the Council
column15:
or will you go for balanced development?

column1: 267@Kingdomino@In Kingdomino
column2: you are a lord seeking new lands in which to expand your kingdom. You must explore all the lands
column3: including wheat fields
column4: lakes
column5: and mountains
column6: in order to spot the best plots
column7:
while competing with other lords to acquire them first.

The game uses tiles with two sections
column8: similar to Dominoes. Each turn
column9: each player will select a new domino to connect to their existing kingdom
column10: making sure at least one of its sides connects to a matching terrain type already in play. The order of who picks first depends on which tile was previously chosen
column11: with better tiles forcing players to pick later in the next round. The game ends when each player has completed a 5x5 grid (or failed to do so)
column12:
and points are counted based on number of connecting tiles and valuable crown symbols.

@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/3h9W8BfB_rltQ48EBmHliw__original/img/DDk3fDr0FkDpkYAcny5LeekB2qg=/0x0/filters:format(png)/pic3132685.png@https://cf.geekdo-images.com/3h9W8BfB_rltQ48EBmHliw__thumb/img/RGpbcY90eBcNLXbHLMBwLrr2uzo=/fit-in/200x150/filters:strip_icc()/pic3132685.png@1.218@25@2@4

column1: 268@The Castles of Burgundy@The Castles of Burgundy is set in the Burgundy region of High Medieval France. Each player takes on the role of an aristocrat
column2: originally controlling a small princedom. While playing
column3: they aim to build settlements and powerful castles
column4: practice trade along the river
column5: exploit silver mines
column6:
and use the knowledge of travelers.

The game is about players taking settlement tiles from the game board and placing them into their princedom
column7: which is represented by the player board. Every tile has a function that starts when the tile is placed in the princedom. The princedom itself consists of several regions
column8:
each of which demands its own type of settlement tile.

The game is played in five phases
column9: each consisting of five rounds. Each phase begins with the game board stocked with settlement tiles and goods tiles. At the beginning of each round
column10: all players roll their two dice
column11: and the player who is currently first in turn order rolls a goods placement die. A goods tile is made available on the game board according to the roll of the goods die. During each round
column12: players take their turns in the current turn order. During their turn
column13:
a player may perform any two of the four possible types of actions:


    Take a settlement tile from the numbered depot on the game board corresponding to one of their dice and place it in the staging area on their player board.
    Place a settlement tile from the staging area of their player board to a space on their player board with a number matching one of their dice in the corresponding region for the type of tile and adjacent to a previously placed settlement tile.
    Deliver goods with a number matching one of their dice.
    Take worker tokens that allow the player to adjust the roll of their dice.


In addition to these actions
column14: a player may buy a settlement tile from the central depot on the game board and place it in the staging area on their player board. If an action triggers the awarding of victory points
column15: those points are immediately recorded. Each settlement tile offers a benefit: additional actions
column16: additional money
column17: advancement on the turn order track
column18: more goods tiles
column19:
die roll adjustment or victory points. Bonus victory points are awarded for filling a region with settlement tiles.

The game ends when the last player finishes their turn of the fifth round of the fifth phase. Victory points are awarded for unused money and workers and for undelivered goods. Bonus victory points from certain settlement tiles are awarded at the end of the game. The player with the most victory points wins.

The 2019 edition of The Castles of Burgundy includes eight expansions
column20:
seven of which were previously released as promotional items and one new to this release.
This edition has one fewer Monastery boards than what came in The Castles of Burgundy: 4th Expansion â€“ Monastery Boards

Eight brave investigators stand ready to confront four scenarios of fear and mystery
column3: collecting weapons
column4: tools
column5: and information

and death. Open the door and step inside these hair-raising Mansions of Madness: Second Edition. It will take more than just survival to conquer the evils terrorizing this town.

column1: 271@Corrosion@In Corrosion
column2: each of you manages a factory and deploys engineers to build up diversified scoring and production engines. In the steam-filled air
column3: however
column4: your biggest enemy is time because most machines and gears rust away quickly
column5:
so you are well advised to also produce chrome gears and invest in rustproof and powerful chrome machines.

On your turn
column6:
you can either play an engineer card or turn the corrosion wheel of your factory:


    Playing engineers mostly gains you new machines and qualified engineers. Other players can copy your engineer's action by playing an engineer of the same suit but a higher grade.



    Turning your corrosion wheel puts your machines to work and returns engineers to your hand
column7:
but also causes old gears and machines to rust.


To be successful
column8:
you must cleverly co-ordinate your engineers and corrosion wheel and smoothly shift from one efficient engine to the next.

The game end is triggered once the special point supply or the award supply run out. Then
column9:
whoever was able to score the most points with their machines and awards wins.

column1:
